metadata.titleEn: The data of zircon U-Pb ages of granites in south Qiangtang of the Tibetan Plateau (2014)
metadata.description:
This data set collected zircon U-Pb isotope age data of the granites in the southern Qiangtang terrane of the Tibetan Plateau from articles published before October 2014. The data were analyzed by Laser Ablation-Inductively Coupled Plasma-Mass Spectrometry (LA-ICPMS), Sensitive High-Resolution Ion Microprobe (SHRIMP), and Isotope Dilution Thermal Ionization Mass Spectrometry (ID TIMS).
The data were obtained according to laboratory standards, and the data quality met laboratory requirements.
The data contents are as follows:
Region 
Locality 
Lithology 
Sample No. 
Dating method 
Age (Ma) 
References

authorList.unitEn: Institute of Tibetan Plateau Research, Chinese Academy of Sciences

literatureList.titleEn: Zircon U–Pb age and Hf isotopic compositions of Mesozoic granitoids in southern Qiangtang, Tibet: Implications for the subduction of the Bangong–Nujiang Tethyan Ocean
literatureList.referenceEn: Liu, D.L., Shi, R.D., Ding, L., Huang, Q.S., Zhang, X.R., Yue, Y.H., &Zhang, L.Y. (2015). Zircon U–Pb age and Hf isotopic compositions of Mesozoic granitoids in southern Qiangtang, Tibet: Implications for the subduction of the Bangong–Nujiang Tethyan Ocean. Gondwana Research, 41, 157-172.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of data collection methods used for determining zircon U-Pb ages in granites from the southern margin of the Qiangtang terrane in the Tibetan Plateau?
Feature Specification.Answer: Laser Ablation-Inductively Coupled Plasma-Mass Spectrometry (LA-ICPMS), Sensitive High Resolution Ion Microprobe (SHRIMP), Isotope Dilution Thermal Ionization Mass Spectrometry (ID TIMS)

Causal Antecedent.Question: What are the underlying reasons for the selection of LA-ICPMS, SHRIMP, and ID TIMS as data collection methods for determining zircon U-Pb ages in granites of the southern Qiangtang terrane?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The selection of LA-ICPMS, SHRIMP, and ID TIMS as data collection methods for determining zircon U-Pb ages in granites of the southern Qiangtang terrane is primarily due to their ability to provide precise and accurate isotopic age data. These methods are well-suited for geological samples and meet laboratory standards for data quality, ensuring reliable results. Additionally, these techniques are widely accepted in the scientific community for such analyses, allowing for consistency and comparability with previously published studies.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the primary objective of collecting zircon U-Pb isotopic age data from granites in the southern Qiangtang terrane of the Tibetan Plateau?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The primary objective of collecting zircon U-Pb isotopic age data from granites in the southern Qiangtang terrane of the Tibetan Plateau is to understand the geological history and evolution of the region by determining the age of rock formations. This data helps in reconstructing tectonic events and provides insights into the processes that have shaped the area over millions of years.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What instrumental techniques are utilized to ensure the precision and accuracy of U-Pb zircon dating in granitic rocks, and what challenges might arise during data collection?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: Instrumental techniques used to ensure precision and accuracy in U-Pb zircon dating for granitic rocks include Laser Ablation-Inductively Coupled Plasma-Mass Spectrometry (LA-ICPMS), Sensitive High Resolution Ion Microprobe (SHRIMP), and Isotope Dilution Thermal Ionization Mass Spectrometry (ID TIMS). These methods are applied following laboratory standards to meet data quality requirements. Challenges that might arise during data collection can include potential contamination, calibration of instruments, and ensuring consistent sample preparation to maintain high data quality.
